definitions.definition: to make somebody believe something that is not true
definitions.sensetop: deceive somebodydeceive somebody into doing something

examples.text: Her husband had been deceiving her for years.
She deceived him into handing over all his savings.

definitions.definition: to refuse to admit to yourself that something unpleasant is true

examples.text: You're deceiving yourself if you think he'll change his mind.

definitions.definition: to make somebody have a wrong idea about somebody/something

examples.text: Unless my eyes deceive me, that's his wife.
the hallmarks of a detective mystery where appearances deceive

definitions.definition: if something flatters to deceive, it appears to be better, more successful, etc. than it really is

examples.text: As with many new bands, their early success flattered to deceive.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French deceivre, from Latin decipere ‘catch, ensnare, cheat’.
